question:
Clinical Scenario:
A 56-year-old man with end-stage liver disease secondary to NASH cirrhosis is undergoing orthotopic liver transplantation. Thirty minutes after reperfusion, the surgical team notes ongoing oozing from the anastomotic site. ROTEM is performed and shows:
	•	EXTEM A10: 35 mm 
	•	EXTEM CFT: 145 s 
	•	FIBTEM A10: 7 mm 
	•	EXTEM CT: 80 s
	•	ML EXTEM: 5%

Clinical Question:
What is the next best step in therapy? Give a precise, single best answer.
answer: This ROTEM result suggests a problem with fibrinogen.  The next best step is to administer fibrinogen concentrate.

query_metadata.question:
#1
Clinical Scenario:
A 56-year-old man with end-stage liver disease secondary to NASH cirrhosis is undergoing orthotopic liver transplantation. Thirty minutes after reperfusion, the surgical team notes ongoing oozing from the anastomotic site. ROTEM is performed and shows:
	•	EXTEM A10: 35 mm 
	•	EXTEM CFT: 145 s 
	•	FIBTEM A10: 7 mm 
	•	EXTEM CT: 80 s
	•	ML EXTEM: 5%

Clinical Question:
What is the next best step in therapy? Give a precise, single best answer.

response_metadata.answer: The ROTEM results suggest a problem with fibrinogen.  The low FIBTEM A10 (7 mm) indicates reduced clot strength due to low fibrinogen.  Therefore, the next best step is to administer fibrinogen concentrate.

sources.content:
Johansson, P.I. (2012) Coagulation monitoring of the bleeding traumatized patient. Current Opinion in Anesthesiology , 25 , 235 -241.

Johansson, P.I. & Stensballe, J. (2009) Effect of haemostatic control resuscitation on mortality in massively bleeding patients: a before and after study. Vox Sanguinis , 96 , 111 -118.

Johansson, P.I., Stensballe, J., Oliveri, R., Wade, C.E., Ostrowski, S.R. & Holcomb, J.B. (2014) How I treat patients with massive hemorrhage. Blood , 124 , 3052 -3058.

## Review process

The document will be reviewed regularly by the relevant Task Force and the literature search will be re-run every 3 years to search for any RCT or other high-quality data that is either new or that may have been missed. The document will be archived and removed from the BSH current guidelines website if it becomes obsolete. If new recommendations are made an addendum will be published on the BSH guidelines website (www.b-s-h.org.uk).

## Disclaimer

While the advice and inform

|                 | Kaolin, TF                            | Kaolin, TF,                 |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
|                 | FF:                                   | CFF:                        | Platelet inhibitor add

query_metadata.question:
#1 Clinical Scenario: A 56-year-old man with end-stage liver disease secondary to NASH cirrhosis is undergoing orthotopic liver transplantation. Thirty minutes after reperfusion, the surgical team notes ongoing oozing from the anastomotic site. ROTEM is performed and shows: • EXTEM A10: 35 mm • EXTEM CFT: 145 s • FIBTEM A10: 7 mm • EXTEM CT: 80 s • ML EXTEM: 5%

Clinical Question: What is the next best step in therapy? Give a precise, single best answer.

response_metadata.answer: Based on the provided ROTEM values, the patient shows signs of fibrinogen deficiency (low FIBTEM A10).  Therefore, the next best step is to administer fibrinogen concentrate.

Coagulation Factor Deficiency Case

Clinical Scenario:
A 62-year-old female undergoing liver transplant for hepatitis C cirrhosis has ROTEM results 15 minutes into the anhepatic phase showing:
	•	EXTEM CT: 145 s 
	•	EXTEM CFT: 120 s
	•	EXTEM A10: 39 mm 
	•	FIBTEM A10: 13 mm
	•	ML EXTEM: 4%

#2

	•	EXTEM CT: 145 s 
	•	EXTEM CFT: 120 s
	•	EXTEM A10: 39 mm 
	•	FIBTEM A10: 13 mm
	•	ML EXTEM: 4%
